hours_text:
# Start your search by typing

# Visit 

### **Welcome to the Gallery!**

Scroll down for the Gallery **Hours of Operation** below and note we are closed Mondays. We look forward to seeing you at the Gallery.

* * *

**On Display**  
The Art Gallery of Greater Victoria is proud to collaborate with artists, art historians, community groups and other cultural organizations to create engaging and relevant exhibitions.  
[CURRENT EXHIBITIONS](https://aggv.ca/exhibits/current/)

* * *

**Bags  
**Backpacks, duffel bags, purses & shopping bags: Please limit the size of your bag and leave any non-essentials at home or in your vehicle. All bags larger than 12″ x 12″ x 9″ are prohibited in the exhibition spaces. Exceptions will only be made for first aid and medical equipment bags. _Thank you for your understanding._

**Free Lockers**  
We have several lockers with keys in our coat room. You are welcome to store your personal belongings in these while you browse the Gallery.

* * *

**Admission  
**$15 

**Purchase tickets online**  
[PURCHASE TICKETS](https://shop.aggv.ca/collections/admissions/products/adult-admission)

  * **Admission is always free for:[AGGV Members](https://aggv.ca/support/membership/)** and SEE ART pass holders, visitors aged 25 and under, all Indigenous Peoples, and support workers accompanying visitors who need assistance (Leisure Assistant Pass holders).
  * **Feel Free – Free Gallery Days Supported by TD Bank Group:** Admission is free on the first Saturday ...

accessibility_text:
# Start your search by typing

# Accessibility 

The Art Gallery of Greater Victoria acknowledges that access needs are different for everyone and that these needs can also change every day. We are committed to offering meaningful access and services to make our institution and programs as accessible and barrier-free as possible.

If you have suggestions about this information or our accessibility services, please email [**visitorservices@aggv.ca**](mailto:visitorservices@aggv.ca) or call 250-384-4171 x 0.  
**  
LEISURE ASSISTANT PASS**

AGGV accepts the Leisure Assistant Pass. This pass is for people of all ages who have a disability and require the assistance of a support person when engaging in leisure activities. The pass provides free admission to one support person to ensure the person with a disability does not pay double for their admission. Passes are available through municipal websites in the Greater Victoria area and are valid for a three-year term from the date of issue.  
[**APPLY FOR PASS**](https://www.victoria.ca/assets/Departments/Parks~Rec~Culture/Recreation/Documents/2020%20Victoria%20Leisure%20Assistant%20Pass.pdf)

**GETTING TO THE GALLERY**

**Address**  
The Gallery is located at 1040 Moss Street and sits on the intersection of Wilspencer Place and Moss Street.  
**[VIEW GOOGLE MAP](https://goo.gl/maps/GUFovL3fDp2w6St57)**

**Entrance**  
The main entrance has four steps with a handrail and a heavy pull bar door. The main entrance is also wheelchair a...
